intro: Acrodiclidium cayennense, commonly known as the Cayenne spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a succulent plant native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features thick, fleshy stems and leaves that store water, aiding in its survival in arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically yellow or green, and are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It contains toxic latex, which can cause skin irritation, making it important to handle with care.
